content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    # Regular expression to match Julia code blocks.
    pattern = r"```julia([^\n]*\n?)+```"m

    # Split the markdown document by lines.
    lines = split(md, "\n")

    # Initialize an empty string to hold the extracted code.
    code_str = ""

    # Loop through each line of the markdown document.
    for (i, line) in enumerate(lines)
        # If a line matches the pattern for a Julia code block, add it to the code string.
        if occursin(pattern, line)
            # Get the captured group which is the actual code content.
            code_block = match(pattern, line).captures[1]
            # Remove the leading and trailing whitespace from the code block.
            trimmed_code_block = strip(code_block)
            # Append the trimmed code block to the code string.
            code_str *= "\n" * trimmed_code_block
        elseif i > 1 && lines[i - 1] == "```julia" # If the line before was a code fence, we're done with that block.
            break
        end
    end

    # Remove leading and trailing whitespace from the extracted code.
    trimmed_code_str = strip(code_str)

    # Return the extracted Julia code as a string.
    return trimmed_code_str
end
```

This function `extract_julia_code` takes a markdown document `md` as an argument and returns a string containing all the extracted Julia code blocks without the ````julia` fences and with each block separated by a newline character.
